title: 5 extremely cynical reasons why England should have no problems at all in international friendly against Germany
text:
5 extremely cynical reasons why England should have no problems at all in international friendly against Germany Famous last words... Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Germany players ruled out of England clash Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
It might be an international friendly, but there is nothing friendly about England vs Germany - at least for England fans. 
It's a game the country expects to win. It's certainly one they want to win. And well, generally, it's one the nation struggles to win, at least when it really matters. 
Fortunately we've picked up on some very cynical potholes that will definitely thwart the German side and ensure England are victorious, happy and glorious. 
At least we think they will... Giddy with excitement (Photo: REUTERS) Mesut Ozil 
Injuries will play a big part in the fixture, and Germany are missing a number of extremely important players. 
Now we're not saying a footballer being injured is something to be happy about. 
Honestly we're not. 
But you all know what the likes of the injured Mesut Ozil is capable of, don't you? Mesut Ozil will miss the friendly (Photo: AFP/Getty) 
Ok, things haven't exactly been going to plan for the Arsenal playmaker this season, but the opportunity to turn out for a different team would have hugely benefited him. 
And he would have almost certainly wanted to get one over the English who have criticised him this season, so England can count themselves lucky! Julian Draxler 
Also injured is Julian Draxler, who has been a bit of a revelation since signing for PSG and stood out in their Champions league first leg win over Barcelona. Julian Draxler will not feature for Germany (Photo: Reuters) 
OK, we know what happened in the second leg, but again, Draxler is an attacking threat that England are fortunate not to be facing. Manuel Neuer 
Another superstar - and we really mean superstar - carrying an injury is the one and only Manuel Neuer. 
Everyone knows just how good the German is between the sticks, but take a look at the above video to see what he is like in front of the opposition goal as well. Germany will miss Manuel Neuer (Photo: Stuart Franklin) 
Honestly, him off the pitch is a benefit for England in so many ways. 
And not just because the German defenders will have no one to chat with when they push up to the halfway line. Mario Gomez 
The final injured player is Mario Gomez. 
The 31-year-old Wolfsburg striker needs absolutely no introduction and has scored in each of his last three Bundesliga fixtures. Mario Gomez will not be playing against England (Photo: Getty) 
A lack of creativity in midfield, a lack of firepower, and a lack of the world's best goalkeeper could make all the difference for England. Stats don't lie 
The game will be staged at Borussia Dortmund's Westfalenstadion. 
Now you'd think that this would benefit Germany - home advantage and all that. 
But in fact, the Germans have lost their last three home matches against England when the game has been played on home soil. Disaster on the horizon? (Photo: REUTERS) 
Also, different managers were behind these wins - Sven Goran Eriksson (5-1 in 2001), Fabio Capello (2-1 in 2008) and Roy Hodgson (3-2 in 2016).
